t: Obadiah 1
Edom Will Be Humbled

The*p vision of Obadiah. Thus*p says the Lord God*s concerning Edom— We*pn have heard a report from the Lord,*s And*ln an envoy has been sent among the nations saying,*i “Arise*ln and let us go against her for battle”—
“Behold,*ln I will make you small among the nations; You*ln are greatly despised.
The*ln arrogance of your heart has deceived you, You*ln who live in the clefts of the rock, In*ln the loftiness of your dwelling place, Who*ln say in your heart, ‘Who*ln will bring me down to earth?’
Though*ln you build high like the eagle, Though*ln you set your nest among the stars, From*ln there I will bring you down,” declares the Lord.*s

“If*ln thieves came to you, If*ln robbers by night— O*ln how you will be ruined!— Would*ln they not steal only*i until they had enough? If*ln grape gatherers came to you, Would*ln they not leave some*i gleanings?
O*ln how Esau will be ransacked, And*iln his hidden treasures searched out!

All*ln the men allied with you Will*ln send you forth to the border, And*ln the men at peace with you Will*ln deceive you and overpower you. They*iln who*i eat*i your bread Will*ln set an ambush for you. (There*ln is no understanding in him.)
Will*ln I not on that day,” declares the Lord,*s “Destroy*ln wise men from Edom And*ln understanding from the mountain of Esau?
Then*ln your mighty men will be dismayed, O Teman, So*ln that everyone may be cut off from the mountain of Esau by slaughter.
“Because*ln of violence to your brother Jacob, You*ln will be covered with*i shame, And*ln you will be cut off forever.
On*ln the day that you stood aloof, On*ln the day that strangers carried off his wealth, And*ln foreigners entered his gate And*ln cast lots for Jerusalem— You*ln too were as one of them.

Do*ln not gloat over your brother’s day, The*ln day of his misfortune. And*ln do not rejoice over the sons of Judah In*ln the day of their destruction; Yes,*ln do not boast In*ln the day of their*i distress.

Do*ln not enter the gate of My people In*ln the day of their disaster. Yes,*ln you, do not gloat over their calamity In*ln the day of their disaster. And*ln do not loot their wealth In*ln the day of their disaster.
Do*ln not stand at the fork of the road To*ln cut down their fugitives; And*ln do not imprison their survivors In*ln the day of their distress.
The Day of the Lord and the Future
“For*pn the day of the Lord*s draws near on all the nations. As*ln you have done, it will be done to you. Your*ln dealings will return on your own head.
Because*ln just as you drank on My holy mountain, All*ln the nations will drink continually. They*ln will drink and swallow And*ln become as if they had never existed.
But*ln on Mount Zion there will be those who escape, And*ln it will be holy. And*ln the house of Jacob will possess their possessions.

Then*ln the house of Jacob will be a fire And*ln the house of Joseph a flame; But*ln the house of Esau will*i be*i as stubble. And*ln they will set them on fire and consume them, So*ln that there will be no survivor of the house of Esau,” For*ln the Lord*s has spoken.

Then*ln those*i of*i the Negev will possess the mountain of Esau, And*ln those*i of*i the Shephelah the Philistine plain;*i Also,*ln possess the territory of Ephraim and the territory of Samaria, And*ln Benjamin will*i possess*i Gilead.

And*ln the exiles of this host of the sons of Israel, Who*ln are among*i the Canaanites as far as Zarephath, And*ln the exiles of Jerusalem who are in Sepharad Will*ln possess the cities of the Negev.
The*ln deliverers will ascend Mount Zion To*ln judge the mountain of Esau, And*ln the kingdom will be the Lord’s.*s
